messages: 08d4ea6d89f6ef4b6eb23554d9f7a979 (02:00): whats the command to dump a table out of a mysql?
5a5d38c51f6271560c676cd0495987df (02:00): what command do i use to turn off mysql?
d0c15d0a638b5b5867c4473feccdbd16 (02:00): mysql 5 why slower than mysql 4 x series ?
e856e3282c0cc38cec457c99fd15999e (02:01): define slower
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:04): goodshit: man mysqldump
0f02b0ecf0c8762c7bac586d8c5466d4 (02:04): !m goodshit mysqldump
ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a (02:04): goodshit: (The mysqldump Database Backup Program) : http://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql/en/mysqldump.html
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:05): Mr_Sako: depends on your distribution. may be "service mysql stop" or "/etc/init.d/mysql stop"
0f02b0ecf0c8762c7bac586d8c5466d4 (02:05): Mr_sako: you can use mysqladmin
01582126c860397e8ce635d5d29f4a7e (02:05): is there an easy way to convert BLOB to TEXT?

01582126c860397e8ce635d5d29f4a7e (02:05): I have an old DB that for some reason had BLOBs in it for text fields, and I need to convert them or, ideally, just be able to do a case insenstive search in those columns
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:05): BaconTastesGood: ALTER TABLE should be able to do it. not sure, though
5a5d38c51f6271560c676cd0495987df (02:05): well im doing this all from command line, im not actualy at this machine its a VPS im renting
5a5d38c51f6271560c676cd0495987df (02:06): thanks for your help
0f02b0ecf0c8762c7bac586d8c5466d4 (02:07): Mr_sako use " mysqldamin -h localhost -u root shutdown "
b37266e12bc7e627ab7b484bf96b7a36 (02:10): http://iownmymusic.org/ http://iownmydvds.org/ .")
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:14): hey, how can i get all rows from a table who are more than a week old?
273747c3d5dd0c729b5fc78ae77bad09 (02:15): am I allowed to use OR in the WHERE section?
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:15): i'm keeping tabs using TIMESTAMP fields
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:15): sharms, yeah
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (02:15): majd: select rows from table where tsfield < now() - interval 1 week;

273747c3d5dd0c729b5fc78ae77bad09 (02:15): can someone tell me what is wrong with my query: SELECT count(*) as total FROM wansol_products WHERE 'itemname' = %amd% OR 'itemdescription' = %amd% OR 'itemsummary' = %amd% OR 'itemupc' = amd
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:15): domas, is that actual syntax?
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (02:15): domas: i was missing a default charset in the [client] section of my my.cnf
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:16): sharms take off the single quotes from field names
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:16): and put them around the values
0f02b0ecf0c8762c7bac586d8c5466d4 (02:16): sharms: you need to qote the valuyes
0f02b0ecf0c8762c7bac586d8c5466d4 (02:16): quote the values
273747c3d5dd0c729b5fc78ae77bad09 (02:16): single or double?
0f02b0ecf0c8762c7bac586d8c5466d4 (02:16): either
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:17): or double
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:17): sharms: Always single.
273747c3d5dd0c729b5fc78ae77bad09 (02:17): thanks a bunch
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:17): Xgc, i always use single from habit
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:18): does it make a difference to use double though?
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:18): didn't think it did....
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:18): majd: If you get used to that, your SQL breaks when you have to comply with ANSI/ISO SQL.
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:18): majd: Double are used for quoting identifiers, like db, table, field names.
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:19): Xgc i thought you use ` for that
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:19): majd: I'm talking about the standard.
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:19): ok, didn't know there was one =\
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:19): majd: MySQL is drifting in that direction.
6857d579004c31f1efc078cb6c8c543f (02:19): .oO(no wonder no one uses the standard)
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (02:24): double quotes are the standard
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (02:24): lsmith: forget that
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:24): domas, just tested it, thanks....it kinda doesn't make sense
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (02:25): domas: ?
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:25): now - 1 week = date one week ago
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:25): shouldn't it be > ?
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:25): i mean it's working, i'm just trying to follow the logic
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (02:25): depends on what you want
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:25): i want older than 1 week
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (02:26): lsmith: well, you can put client charset to [client] section, but... it will be used just by commands that call mysql_options()
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (02:26): lsmith: and PHP does not.
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (02:26): nor any other API implicitly
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (02:26): hmm .. well i was adding default charset all over the place
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (02:26): and now it seems to work ..
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:28): majd: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/ansi-mode.html
9980c6a2c2fbf516fa29cab8a8ee43a1 (02:28): what's the neatest way to return a random id from a set that can be selected with a where clause?
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:28): The modes impacted are: 'REAL_AS_FLOAT,PIPES_AS_CONCAT,ANSI_QUOTES,IGNORE_SPACE,ANSI'
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:28): Xgc, by the way, thanks a lot for helping me 2-3 weeks ago, if it wasn't for you, my code would've been much more spaghettied
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (02:29): majd: *nod*  No problem at all.
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (02:30): lsmith: you can skip charset handshake
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (02:30): lsmith: but that'd be a hack
9980c6a2c2fbf516fa29cab8a8ee43a1 (02:37): to answer myself, SELECT blah WHERE clause ORDER BY RAND();
27fa0f96dfc03bb1f2bebd6fee16f716 (02:39): http://jan.kneschke.de/projects/mysql/order-by-rand/
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:39): ok, is there an easy way to copy complete rows from one table to another?
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:39): is insert select the only way?
0311963ee43c84f5d278b5ff866a7782 (02:40): what is wrong about insert select?
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:40): i don't know...i can't figure out how to set it up
41c7d95fbdf0c0981ad5d04f2ed53898 (02:41): majd: INSERT INTO destinationTable SELECT columns FROM fromTable WHERE whereCondition

66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:41): i have a table users i want to copy all the fields (id  loginsessionid  date_signup  last_login  name  email  password  gender  birthday temp) to deleted_users_backup
41c7d95fbdf0c0981ad5d04f2ed53898 (02:41): majd: INSERT INTO destinationTable SELECT columns FROM fromTable WHERE whereCondition
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:41): with the condition:  WHERE last_login < now() - interval 1 week AND temp='yes'
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:42): ok, let me try this
41c7d95fbdf0c0981ad5d04f2ed53898 (02:45): majd: full docs at http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/insert-select.html
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:45): nzeyimana, thanks...workin on it
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:49): Operand should contain 1 column(s)

66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:49): INSERT INTO deleted_users_backup SELECT (id,loginsessionid,date_signup,last_login,name,email,password,gender,birthday,temp) FROM users WHERE last_login < now() - interval 1 week AND temp='yes'
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:49): took out the ( and )
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:49): now it doesn't give me an error
8942b6d335d4f7f98fc102a85908d86c (02:50): GUI tools is a good idea !
41c7d95fbdf0c0981ad5d04f2ed53898 (02:53): If you are not inserting a a row with all the columns, you should include the list of the columns.
41c7d95fbdf0c0981ad5d04f2ed53898 (02:54): Like INSERT INTO destinationTable (col_list) SELECT col_list FROM fromTable WHERE where_condition
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:55): nzeyimana, ok, i got it to work
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:55): thanks a lot

66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:56): INSERT INTO deleted_users_backup SELECT id,loginsessionid,date_signup,last_login,name,email,password,gender,birthday,temp FROM users WHERE last_login < now() - interval 1 hour AND temp='yes'
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:56): that's the query i used
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:56): in case you were wondering
66f7a0d605bf769a2146edfc96e6b622 (02:56): but, is there a way to see how many rows were moved?
